clusters.title: Gaza border crossing due to reopen after years of near-complete closure
clusters.neutral_headline: Gaza border crossing due to reopen after years of near-complete closure

items.title: Gaza border crossing due to reopen after years of near-complete closure
items.standfirst: Gaza’s Rafah border crossing with Egypt showed signs of activity Sunday as Israel said that limited travel to and from the territory is set to resume after years of near-complete isolation. Reopening the border crossing is a key step as the Israel-Hamas ceasefire moves ahead. Story by Camille Knight.
items.content: Gaza’s Rafah border crossing with Egypt showed signs of activity Sunday as Israel said that limited travel to and from the territory is set to resume after years of near-complete isolation. Reopening the border crossing is a key step as the Israel-Hamas ceasefire moves ahead. Story by Camille Knight.

items.title: Israel reopens Rafah crossing for 'limited passage'
items.standfirst: Israel announced on Sunday that it had reopened the Rafah border crossing between Gaza and Egypt for "limited passage."Israel's Coordinator of the Government Activities in the Territories (COGAT) stat...
items.content: Israel announced on Sunday that it had reopened the Rafah border crossing between Gaza and Egypt for "limited passage."Israel's Coordinator of the Government Activities in the Territories (COGAT) stat...

clusters.title: Iran warns US against military action amid tentative negotiations
clusters.neutral_headline: Iran warns US against military action amid tentative negotiations

items.title: Iran warns US against military action amid tentative negotiations
items.standfirst: Iran's top security official said Saturday that progress had been made towards negotiations with the United States, even as the Islamic republic's army chief warned Washington against launching military strikes. US President Donald Trump confirmed the two sides were talking, while keeping the threat of an attack in the foreground. Story by Morgan Ayre.
items.content: Iran's top security official said Saturday that progress had been made towards negotiations with the United States, even as the Islamic republic's army chief warned Washington against launching military strikes. US President Donald Trump confirmed the two sides were talking, while keeping the threat of an attack in the foreground. Story by Morgan Ayre.

items.title: Iran's supreme leader warns any US attack would spark 'regional war'
items.standfirst: Iran's supreme leader warned Sunday that any attack by the United States would spark a "regional war" in the Mideast, further escalating tensions as President Donald Trump has threatened to militarily strike the Islamic Republic.
items.content: Iran's supreme leader warned Sunday that any attack by the United States would spark a "regional war" in the Mideast, further escalating tensions as President Donald Trump has threatened to militarily strike the Islamic Republic.(Image credit: Seaman Daniel Kimmelman)

items.title: Live: Iran's ‍Khamenei ​warns ⁠of regional ‌conflict if US starts a war
items.standfirst: Iran's ​Supreme ⁠Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei ​said ‍in Sunday that ​if the ​US attacked Iran it could become a ‍regional ​conflict, the semi-official Tasnim ‌news agency reported. Earlier Iran’s parliament said it considers all EU militaries to be terrorist groups in a retaliatory move following an EU agreement last week to class Iran's Revolutionary Guard as a terrorist group. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

items.title: Iran warns of regional war risk as Trump sends 'very big, powerful ships'
items.standfirst: Iran's Supreme Leader has warned Donald Trump that the entire region will be engulfed in conflict if the US starts a war.
items.content: Iran's Supreme Leader has warned Donald Trump that the entire region will be engulfed in conflict if the US starts a war.

items.title: Iran ready for talks or war, foreign minister says as Trump weighs military action
items.standfirst: Pressure was building on Iran on Friday as President Donald Trump weighed a military strike on the Islamic Republic and the Treasury Department sanctioned several officials it said were responsible for the regime’s brutal crackdown on its own people.

items.title: More than 200 killed in mine collapse in DR Congo
items.standfirst: More than 200 people have been killed in a mine collapse in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, rebel authorities have said. The mine, in the town of Rubaya, gave way on Wednesday due to heavy rains, Lumumba Kambere Muyisa, spokesman for the North Kivu region's rebel governor, told reporters. At…
items.content: More than 200 people have been killed in a mine collapse in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, rebel authorities have said. The mine, in the town of Rubaya, gave way on Wednesday due to heavy rains, Lumumba Kambere Muyisa, spokesman for the North Kivu region's rebel governor, told reporters. At…

items.title: Mine collapses in eastern Congo, leaving at least 200 dead
items.standfirst: The collapse happened Wednesday due to heavy rains at the rebel-controlled Rubaya mines. Congo is a major supplier of coltan, which contains a key component in the production of smartphones.
items.content: The collapse happened Wednesday due to heavy rains at the rebel-controlled Rubaya mines. Congo is a major supplier of coltan, which contains a key component in the production of smartphones.(Image credit: Moses Sawasawa)

items.title: More than 200 killed in mine collapse in DR Congo
items.standfirst: The mine gave way after heavy rains on Wednesday, a local rebel spokesman says.
items.content: The mine gave way after heavy rains on Wednesday, a local rebel spokesman says.

items.title: More than 200 killed after landslide collapses smartphone mineral mines
items.standfirst: More than 200 people have been reported dead after a landslide hit coltan mines in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
items.content: More than 200 people have been reported dead after a landslide hit coltan mines in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

items.title: More than 200 killed in coltan mine collapse in eastern DRC, officials say
items.standfirst: Rubaya mine produces about 15% of the world’s coltan, which is processed into tantalum, used in mobile phonesMore than 200 people were killed this week in a collapse at the Rubaya coltan mine in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, Lumumba Kambere Muyisa, a spokesperson for the rebel-appointed governor of the province where the mine is located, told Reuters on Friday.Rubaya produces about 15% of the world’s coltan, which is processed into tantalum – a heat-resistant metal that is in high demand by makers of mobile phones, computers, aerospace components and gas turbines. The site, where local people dig manually for a few dollars a day, has been under the control of the M23 rebel group since 2024. Continue reading...
items.content: Rubaya mine produces about 15% of the world’s coltan, which is processed into tantalum, used in mobile phonesMore than 200 people were killed this week in a collapse at the Rubaya coltan mine in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, Lumumba Kambere Muyisa, a spokesperson for the rebel-appointed governor of the province where the mine is located, told Reuters on Friday.Rubaya produces about 15% of the world’s coltan, which is processed into tantalum – a heat-resistant metal that is in high demand by makers of mobile phones, computers, aerospace components and gas turbines. The site, where local people dig manually for a few dollars a day, has been under the control of the M23 rebel group since 2024. Continue reading...

clusters.title: ‘No ICE in Italy’: Hundreds protest Winter Olympic deployment
clusters.neutral_headline: ‘No ICE in Italy’: Hundreds protest Winter Olympic deployment

items.title: ‘No ICE in Italy’: Hundreds protest Winter Olympic deployment
items.standfirst: Hundreds of protesters in Italy have denounced plans to bring ICE agents from the US to the Winter Olympics in Milan.
items.content: Hundreds of protesters in Italy have denounced plans to bring ICE agents from the US to the Winter Olympics in Milan.

items.title: 'We don't want them here': Italians in Milan protest ICE's role in Winter Olympics
items.standfirst: The Department of Homeland Security said that Homeland Security Investigations, a unit of ICE, will be in Italy for the 2026 Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics to support U.S. diplomatic security. NBC News' Claudio Lavanga spoke to Italians who gathered in Milan to protest ICE's role at the Games.
items.content: The Department of Homeland Security said that Homeland Security Investigations, a unit of ICE, will be in Italy for the 2026 Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics to support U.S. diplomatic security. NBC News' Claudio Lavanga spoke to Italians who gathered in Milan to protest ICE's role at the Games.

items.title: 'Creeping fascism': Milan protesters slam ICE deployment at Winter Olympics
items.standfirst: Protesters on Saturday gathered at Milan's Piazza XXV Aprile, a square named for the date of Italy’s liberation from Nazi fascism in 1945, to protest the deployment of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents during the upcoming Winter Olympics there. Demonstrators in the Italian city denounced what they called "creeping fascism" in the US.
items.content: Protesters on Saturday gathered at Milan's Piazza XXV Aprile, a square named for the date of Italy’s liberation from Nazi fascism in 1945, to protest the deployment of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents during the upcoming Winter Olympics there. Demonstrators in the Italian city denounced what they called "creeping fascism" in the US.

items.title: Hundreds protest against ICE role in Winter Olympics in Milan
items.standfirst: Hundreds of protesters have gathered in Milan, Italy, to protest against the deployment of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) staff at the upcoming Winter Olympics.
items.content: Hundreds of protesters have gathered in Milan, Italy, to protest against the deployment of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) staff at the upcoming Winter Olympics.

clusters.title: Israeli air strikes kill at least 32 Palestinians in Gaza, rescue officials say
clusters.neutral_headline: Israeli air strikes kill at least 32 Palestinians in Gaza, rescue officials say

items.title: Israeli air strikes kill at least 32 Palestinians in Gaza, rescue officials say
items.standfirst: Israel's military confirmed the strikes, which come during a ceasefire that Israel and Hamas accuse each other of breaking.
items.content: Israel's military confirmed the strikes, which come during a ceasefire that Israel and Hamas accuse each other of breaking.

items.title: 'There's no ceasefire': Israeli strikes kill 30 Palestinians, including children, in Gaza
items.standfirst: Israeli air strikes killed at east 30 people in Gaza Saturday, including children, according to hospitals, as the military said it attacked in response to a Hamas ceasefire violation. Despite a US-brokered ceasefire entering its second phase earlier this month, violence in the Palestinian territory has continued, with both Israel and Hamas accusing each other of violating the truce agreement.
items.content: Israeli air strikes killed at east 30 people in Gaza Saturday, including children, according to hospitals, as the military said it attacked in response to a Hamas ceasefire violation. Despite a US-brokered ceasefire entering its second phase earlier this month, violence in the Palestinian territory has continued, with both Israel and Hamas accusing each other of violating the truce agreement.

items.title: Children and police officers among at least 30 killed in Israeli strikes on Gaza
items.standfirst: Deadly attacks launched day before border crossing due to open as part of ceasefire dealIsrael has carried out some of its deadliest airstrikes on Gaza in months, killing at least 30 Palestinians, some of whom were sheltering in tent cities for displaced people.Despite a nominal ceasefire, the Israeli military struck a police station in the Sheikh Radwan neighbourhood west of Gaza City on Saturday, killing 10 officers and detainees, the civil defence said. It indicated the death toll could rise as emergency responders searched for bodies. Continue reading...
items.content: Deadly attacks launched day before border crossing due to open as part of ceasefire dealIsrael has carried out some of its deadliest airstrikes on Gaza in months, killing at least 30 Palestinians, some of whom were sheltering in tent cities for displaced people.Despite a nominal ceasefire, the Israeli military struck a police station in the Sheikh Radwan neighbourhood west of Gaza City on Saturday, killing 10 officers and detainees, the civil defence said. It indicated the death toll could rise as emergency responders searched for bodies. Continue reading...

items.title: Israeli strikes on Gaza kill dozens as violence continues despite ceasefire
items.standfirst: Hospitals in Gaza said Israeli strikes killed at least 29 Palestinians Saturday, one of the highest tolls since the October ceasefire aimed at stopping the fighting. A day after Israel accused Hamas of new ceasefire violations, strikes hit locations throughout Gaza, including lethal ones on an apartment building in Gaza City and a tent camp in Khan Younis, officials at hospitals that received the bodies said.
items.content: Hospitals in Gaza said Israeli strikes killed at least 29 Palestinians Saturday, one of the highest tolls since the October ceasefire aimed at stopping the fighting. A day after Israel accused Hamas of new ceasefire violations, strikes hit locations throughout Gaza, including lethal ones on an apartment building in Gaza City and a tent camp in Khan Younis, officials at hospitals that received the bodies said.

items.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 30 across Gaza in one of highest tolls since October ceasefire
items.standfirst: New Israeli air strikes slammed targets across Gaza on Saturday, including a Gaza City residential building and a tent camp Khan Younis, killing at least 30 people, hospital officials said. The strikes come just a day before the announced reopening of the enclave's Rafah crossing with Egypt and mark a continually rising death toll as Israel and Hamas trade accusations of violating the ceasefire.
items.content: New Israeli air strikes slammed targets across Gaza on Saturday, including a Gaza City residential building and a tent camp Khan Younis, killing at least 30 people, hospital officials said. The strikes come just a day before the announced reopening of the enclave's Rafah crossing with Egypt and mark a continually rising death toll as Israel and Hamas trade accusations of violating the ceasefire.

items.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 30 Palestinians in Gaza, hospital officials say
items.standfirst: At least 30 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli strikes on Saturday, according to hospitals in Gaza.
items.content: At least 30 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli strikes on Saturday, according to hospitals in Gaza.

clusters.title: Second woman alleges Epstein sent her to UK to have sex with Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor
clusters.neutral_headline: Ex-Prince Andrew Faces New Epstein Sexual Allegation

items.title: Second woman alleges Epstein sent her to UK to have sex with Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor
items.standfirst: Woman claims she spent night at Royal Lodge and had tour of Buckingham Palace, says lawyerA second woman has alleged that Jeffrey Epstein sent her to the UK to have a sexual encounter with Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, according to her lawyer.The woman has claimed she spent the night at the former prince’s residence Royal Lodge in 2010, her US lawyer, Brad Edwards, told the BBC. The woman, who is not British, was in her 20s at the time, it was reported.In the UK and Ireland, Samaritans can be contacted on freephone 116 123, or email jo@samaritans.org or jo@samaritans.ie. In the US, you can call or text the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline on 988, chat on 988lifeline.org, or text HOME to 741741 to connect with a crisis counselor. In Australia, the crisis support service Lifeline is 13 11 14. Other international helplines can be found at befrienders.org Continue reading...
items.content: Woman claims she spent night at Royal Lodge and had tour of Buckingham Palace, says lawyerA second woman has alleged that Jeffrey Epstein sent her to the UK to have a sexual encounter with Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, according to her lawyer.The woman has claimed she spent the night at the former prince’s residence Royal Lodge in 2010, her US lawyer, Brad Edwards, told the BBC. The woman, who is not British, was in her 20s at the time, it was reported.In the UK and Ireland, Samaritans can be contacted on freephone 116 123, or email jo@samaritans.org or jo@samaritans.ie. In the US, you can call or text the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline on 988, chat on 988lifeline.org, or text HOME to 741741 to connect with a crisis counselor. In Australia, the crisis support service Lifeline is 13 11 14. Other international helplines can be found at befrienders.org Continue reading...

items.title: Democrat Taylor Rehmet wins a reliably Republican Texas state Senate seat, stunning GOP
items.standfirst: Democrat Taylor Rehmet won a special election for the Texas state Senate on Saturday, flipping a reliably Republican district that President Donald Trump won by 17 points in 2024.
items.content: Democrat Taylor Rehmet won a special election for the Texas state Senate on Saturday, flipping a reliably Republican district that President Donald Trump won by 17 points in 2024.(Image credit: Eric Gay)

clusters.title: Five killed in gas explosions in Iran, officials say
clusters.neutral_headline: Five killed in gas explosions in Iran, officials say

items.title: Five killed in gas explosions in Iran, officials say
items.standfirst: Fourteen people are reportedly injured after separate blasts were reported on Saturday.
items.content: Fourteen people are reportedly injured after separate blasts were reported on Saturday.

items.title: Explosion in Iranian port city ahead of Iran's naval drill in the Strait of Hormuz
items.standfirst: The blast happened a day before a planned naval drill by Iran in the Strait of Hormuz, the narrow mouth of the Persian Gulf through which a fifth of all oil traded passes.
items.content: The blast happened a day before a planned naval drill by Iran in the Strait of Hormuz, the narrow mouth of the Persian Gulf through which a fifth of all oil traded passes.

items.title: Deadly blast rips Iranian port city as Tehran plans naval drills in Strait of Hormuz
items.standfirst: An explosion at a building in the southern Iranian port city of Bandar Abbas on Saturday killed one person and wounded 14, according to authorities. The blast came a day before a planned Iranian naval drill in the strategic Strait of Hormuz. Amid frantic regional diplomatic efforts to de-escalate tensions, President Donald Trump on Saturday said Iran was "taking to us".
items.content: An explosion at a building in the southern Iranian port city of Bandar Abbas on Saturday killed one person and wounded 14, according to authorities. The blast came a day before a planned Iranian naval drill in the strategic Strait of Hormuz. Amid frantic regional diplomatic efforts to de-escalate tensions, President Donald Trump on Saturday said Iran was "taking to us".

items.title: Gas leaks blamed for explosions in two Iranian cities
items.standfirst: An explosion reported on Saturday at a residential building in the southern Iranian city of Bandar Abbas on the Gulf coast was the result of a gas leak, according to the local fire chief. Another explosions in the city of Ahvaz near the Iraqi border had also earlier been blamed on a gas leak, according to state media.
items.content: An explosion reported on Saturday at a residential building in the southern Iranian city of Bandar Abbas on the Gulf coast was the result of a gas leak, according to the local fire chief. Another explosions in the city of Ahvaz near the Iraqi border had also earlier been blamed on a gas leak, according to state media.

items.title: Explosions at two Iranian cities amid rising tensions with US
items.standfirst: At least one person was killed and 14 injured in an explosion in the ⁠southern Iranian port of Bandar Abbas on Saturday, a local official told Iranian news agencies, but the cause of the blast was not known. Separately, four people were killed after a gas explosion in the city of Ahvaz near the Iraqi border, according to state-run Tehran Times. The blasts come at a tense time after a major US military deployment to the region.
items.content: At least one person was killed and 14 injured in an explosion in the ⁠southern Iranian port of Bandar Abbas on Saturday, a local official told Iranian news agencies, but the cause of the blast was not known. Separately, four people were killed after a gas explosion in the city of Ahvaz near the Iraqi border, according to state-run Tehran Times. The blasts come at a tense time after a major US military deployment to the region.

items.title: Iran explosions: What we know so far
items.standfirst: An explosion rocked the southern Iranian port of Bandar Abbas on Saturday, Iranian news agencies said, but the cause of the blast was not known. The semi-official Tasnim news agency said that social media reports alleging that a Revolutionary Guard navy commander had been targeted were "completely false". Separately, four people were killed after a gas explosion in the city of Ahvaz near the Iraqi border, according to state-run Tehran Times. France 24’s international affairs editor Kethevane Gorjestani takes a look at what we know so far.
items.content: An explosion rocked the southern Iranian port of Bandar Abbas on Saturday, Iranian news agencies said, but the cause of the blast was not known. The semi-official Tasnim news agency said that social media reports alleging that a Revolutionary Guard navy commander had been targeted were "completely false". Separately, four people were killed after a gas explosion in the city of Ahvaz near the Iraqi border, according to state-run Tehran Times. France 24’s international affairs editor Kethevane Gorjestani takes a look at what we know so far.

clusters.title: SpaceX has stopped Russia's 'unauthorised' use of Starlink against Ukraine, Musk says
clusters.neutral_headline: Musk says steps to stop Russia from using Starlink seem to have worked

items.title: SpaceX has stopped Russia's 'unauthorised' use of Starlink against Ukraine, Musk says
items.standfirst: Elon Musk said on Saturday that measures taken by his company SpaceX have stopped Russia from using its Starlink internet system. Ukraine previously said that it found Russia had used Starlink to guide long-range drones used in attacks on its territory.
items.content: Elon Musk said on Saturday that measures taken by his company SpaceX have stopped Russia from using its Starlink internet system. Ukraine previously said that it found Russia had used Starlink to guide long-range drones used in attacks on its territory.

items.title: Musk says steps to stop Russia from using Starlink seem to have worked
items.standfirst: Elon Musk said on Sunday that steps SpaceX had taken to stop the 'unauthorized' use of Starlink by Russia seemed to have worked. clusters.title: OpenAI Investment Was ‘Never a Commitment,’ Nvidia’s Huang Says
clusters.neutral_headline: OpenAI Investment Was ‘Never a Commitment,’ Nvidia’s Huang Says

items.title: OpenAI Investment Was ‘Never a Commitment,’ Nvidia’s Huang Says
OpenAI Investment Was ‘Never a Commitment,’ Nvidia’s Huang Says
items.standfirst: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said the company’s proposed $100 billion investment in OpenAI was “never a commitment” and that the company would consider any funding rounds “one at a time.”
items.content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said the company’s proposed $100 billion investment in OpenAI was “never a commitment” and that the company would consider any funding rounds “one at a time.”

items.title: Nvidia CEO Supports All Developers Amid DeepSeek Claims
items.standfirst: Nvidia Corp. supports “every developer” that uses its software, Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said, after a US lawmaker accused the chip giant of offering technical support that helped China’s DeepSeek improve its artificial intelligence model. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Nvidia Corp. supports “every developer” that uses its software, Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said, after a US lawmaker accused the chip giant of offering technical support that helped China’s DeepSeek improve its artificial intelligence model. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Jensen Huang Speaks on OpenAI Financing
items.standfirst: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang spoke to press in Taipei, Taiwan on OpenAI financing saying "we'll definitely participate in the next round of financing because it's such a good investment." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang spoke to press in Taipei, Taiwan on OpenAI financing saying "we'll definitely participate in the next round of financing because it's such a good investment." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Jensen Huang Speaks on OpenAI investment
items.standfirst: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang spoke to press in Taipei, Taiwan saying their investment in OpenAI will probably be the "largest investment we've ever made". (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang spoke to press in Taipei, Taiwan saying their investment in OpenAI will probably be the "largest investment we've ever made". (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Nvidia CEO Says New OpenAI Investment May Be Largest Yet
items.standfirst: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said the company will be participating in OpenAI’s latest funding round, describing it as potentially “the largest investment we’ve ever made.”
items.content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said the company will be participating in OpenAI’s latest funding round, describing it as potentially “the largest investment we’ve ever made.”

items.title: LA Olympics chief says he ‘deeply regrets’ emails with Ghislaine Maxwell
items.standfirst: Latest Epstein file release shows 2003 emails between Casey Wasserman and the convicted sex traffickerCasey Wasserman, the head of the Los Angeles Olympics organizing committee, said on Saturday that he “deeply regrets” emails from 2003 between him and Ghislaine Maxwell that appeared in the latest collection of government files released Friday on Jeffrey Epstein.Among the exchanges included one from Wasserman telling Maxwell “I think of you all the time. So, what do I have to do to see you in a tight leather outfit?” Continue reading...
items.content: Latest Epstein file release shows 2003 emails between Casey Wasserman and the convicted sex traffickerCasey Wasserman, the head of the Los Angeles Olympics organizing committee, said on Saturday that he “deeply regrets” emails from 2003 between him and Ghislaine Maxwell that appeared in the latest collection of government files released Friday on Jeffrey Epstein.Among the exchanges included one from Wasserman telling Maxwell “I think of you all the time. So, what do I have to do to see you in a tight leather outfit?” Continue reading...

items.title: India Electronics Manufacturing Shares Jump on Budget Boost
Indian Electronics Manufacturing Shares Rise on Budget Boost
items.standfirst: Shares of some Indian electronics manufacturing services companies ended higher in Sunday trading after the finance minister set aside 400 billion rupees ($4.3 billion) to boost the sector and position the country as a global hub for the sector.
items.content: Shares of some Indian electronics manufacturing services companies ended higher in Sunday trading after the finance minister set aside 400 billion rupees ($4.3 billion) to boost the sector and position the country as a global hub for the sector.

items.title: U.S. military issues warning as Iran prepares to conduct live fire drills
items.standfirst: The U.S. military has assembled a formidable force within striking distance of Iran. Meanwhile, Iran said it would be starting live fire drills in the Strait of Hormuz this weekend as tensions in the region are sky high. Haley Ott reports.
items.content: The U.S. military has assembled a formidable force within striking distance of Iran. Meanwhile, Iran said it would be starting live fire drills in the Strait of Hormuz this weekend as tensions in the region are sky high. Haley Ott reports.

items.title: U.S. warns Iran over planned military drills close to American forces
items.standfirst: The United States warned Iran on Saturday over its plans to conduct live-fire drills close to U.S. forces in the region, as partners sought to de-escalate rising tensions between the two nations
items.content: The United States warned Iran on Saturday over its plans to conduct live-fire drills close to U.S. forces in the region, as partners sought to de-escalate rising tensions between the two nations
